alert.note: Alert for Chatham (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 22 at 3:56PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 430 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Georgia, including the following county, Chatham. * WHEN...Until 430 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 353 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated scattered thunderstorms with torrential rainfall over central and eastern portions of Downtown Savannah. These storms continue to move areas that experienced flooding earlier. Some roadways such as East Presidents Street are likely still experiencing flooding and may become impassible if heavy rain persists. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Hutchinson Island, Midtown Savannah, Downtown Savannah, Wilmington Island, Hunter Army Airfield, Thunderbolt, Whitemarsh Island, Savannah Historic District, Isle Of Armstrong, Gordonston, Fernwood, Lepageville, Savannah State University, Fleetwood, Bona Bella, Edgemere, Fairfield and Ridgewood.
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
